articles.author: Emma Farge, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: The United States and China said on Monday they have agreed a deal to slash reciprocal tariffs for now as the world's two biggest economies seek to end a trade war that has disrupted the global outlook and set financial markets on edge.
articles.title: US and China reach deal to slash trade tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The release, which could come as early as Monday, could open the way to freeing the rest of the 59 hostages still held in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel says not committed to Hamas ceasefire, only to safe corridor for U.S. hostage release

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kurdistan Workers Party militant group, which has been in conflict with the Turkish state for more than four decades, has decided to dissolve itself and end its armed struggle, a news agency close to the group reported.
articles.title: Kurdish PKK disbands and ends Turkey insurgency, PKK-linked agency says

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli officials have put a brave face on U.S. President Donald Trump bypassing them on a Middle East trip this week, but his decision to do so is the latest to sow doubt in Israel about where it stands in Washington's priorities.
articles.title: As Trump heads to the Gulf, Israel asks where it stands
India, Pakistan military operations chiefs hold talks, Indian army says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV, in his first address to the media, spoke out against partisan bickering and called for the release of imprisoned journalists.
articles.title: Pope rejects 'war of words', urges release of jailed reporters

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen
articles.description: Hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial is due to kick off with opening statements on Monday, with prosecutors set to argue that the Bad Boy Records founder used his fame and fortune to abuse women and the defense expected to counter that there is nothing criminal about a "swingers" lifestyle.
articles.title: Sex trafficker or 'swinger'? Hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs goes on trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Half a million people in the Gaza Strip face starvation, a global hunger monitor said on Monday, saying the Israeli-blockaded enclave still confronts a critical risk of famine with a high risk of one occurring by the end of September.
articles.title: Gaza population faces critical risk of famine, global hunger monitor says

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: The first 49 white South Africans deemed victims of racial discrimination and granted refugee status under an offer by U.S. President Donald Trump were flying to the U.S. on Monday in a move deepening frictions between the two nations.
articles.title: First white South Africans fly to US under Trump refugee plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The leader of a British-based Russian spy ring which prosecutors said carried out surveillance for the Kremlin was sentenced in a London court on Monday to nearly 11 years in jail, as his five team members were jailed for a total of about 40 years.
articles.title: Russian spy ring leader jailed in UK for nearly 11 years
